title: New ‘common sense’ rule: US ends automatic work permit renewal; tightens immigration norms
content: New Trump administration rules will end automatic work permit extensions for migrants.  Applicants must now undergo fresh screening before their Employment Authorization Documents are renewed.  This aims to enhance vetting and deter fraud, ensuring only eligible individuals continue working legally in the US The change takes effect October 30, 2025.

title: Women’s WC semifinal: Yellow Watch in Mumbai! Will rain play spoilsport as India face Australia?
content: India and Australia's ICC Women's ODI World Cup 2025 semifinal faces potential rain disruption, with heavy morning showers predicted. However, forecasts suggest clearer skies by the afternoon, with a reserve day in place to ensure the match proceeds. If completely washed out, Australia would advance due to their higher group stage ranking.

title: Amazon's biggest layoffs: Read HR head's email to employees; Reveals the reason
content: Amazon is laying off approximately 14,000 corporate employees, its largest job cuts since the pandemic. Despite posting $18 billion in quarterly profits, the company cites transformative AI technology as a reason for reducing bureaucracy and redirecting resources. Affected employees will receive 90 days of full pay and benefits, severance, and job placement support.

title: US Fed cuts rate by 25 bps: Powell says economic outlook uncertain; Dec cut ‘not forgone conclusion’
content: The Federal Open Market Committee, led by Chairman Jerome Powell, has reduced the benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 3.75-4.00 percent. This move aims to bolster the US economy amidst tariff adjustments and assess the impact of the ongoing government shutdown.

title: Tragedy! Hit in neck by ball - Young cricketer dies during practice
content: A promising 17-year-old Australian cricketer, Ben Austin, tragically passed away after being struck by a ball during a practice session in Melbourne. The freak accident occurred while he was facing deliveries from a bowling machine. His local sporting community is devastated by the loss of the talented young athlete, with grief support being offered to his schoolmates.

title: 'They may send him at No. 11 next!': Ex-India opener slams handling of Sanju Samson's batting role
content: Former India cricketer Kris Srikkanth fiercely defended Sanju Samson, calling him 'unlucky' due to inconsistent batting positions despite strong T20 performances. Srikkanth highlighted Samson's success as an opener and criticised his frequent shuffling from No. 3 to No. 8. He believes Samson is now the automatic T20 World Cup wicketkeeper choice.

title: Service outage: AWS faces second outage this month; Amazon services hit again
content: Internet giant AWS faced its second major outage this month, disrupting popular platforms like Snapchat, Reddit, and Slack.  Thousands reported issues, though AWS claims normal operations.  This follows a costly 15-hour disruption earlier, raising concerns about cloud reliance and infrastructure stress, particularly in its busiest US data center.

title: Hurricane Melissa: 25 dead in Haiti; river bursts banks, homes swept away
content: Hurricane Melissa's devastating passage through the Caribbean has resulted in at least 25 deaths in Petit-Goave, Haiti, due to severe flooding from the La Digue river. The catastrophic Category 5 storm also caused widespread destruction in Jamaica and Cuba, leaving thousands homeless and without power.

title: CSK have found Dhoni’s replacement? Young keeper pulls off ‘Thala’-like brilliance - Watch
content: Chennai Super Kings' young wicketkeeper-batter Urvil Patel impressed with a lightning-fast stumping reminiscent of MS Dhoni. He also showcased his batting prowess with a fighting century for Gujarat in the Ranji Trophy. Patel's performances highlight his potential to carry forward the Dhoni legacy.

title: Global Microsoft Azure Outage: Company says issue identified; engineers rolling back changes
content: Microsoft's Azure cloud platform is experiencing a widespread outage, impacting services like Microsoft 365 and Xbox. A DNS configuration change has been identified as the cause, disrupting the translation of internet addresses to IP addresses. Microsoft is working to roll back the change and reroute traffic to restore service availability globally.

title: Delhi's attempt to make rain: The good, the bad, and what if it really pours
content: And yet, every so often, we try. From Beijing to Dubai, humans have spent decades firing silver iodide into clouds, hoping to bend the weather to our will. The latest to attempt this act of atmospheric persuasion was Delhi — a city so desperate for clean air it decided to summon rain from a clear sky.

title: Killed PIO in Canada as he didn't pay up: Bishnoi gang
content: The Lawrence Bishnoi gang has claimed responsibility for the murder of Canadian businessman Darshan Singh Sahsi and an attack on singer Channi Nattan's residence. These acts demonstrate defiance following Canada's designation of the group as a terrorist entity, highlighting their reach and capability to strike within the country.

title: Michael Irvin: Cowboys legend gets emotional as wife fades to Alzheimer’s
content: Football legend Michael Irvin is bravely navigating a personal crisis as his wife, Sandy Harrell, battles very early-onset Alzheimer's.  Initially mistaken for menopause, the disease's subtle signs emerged a decade ago.  Irvin is now dedicated to ensuring Sandy's comfort and dignity at home, employing a 24-hour nurse and live-in caregiver, showcasing his profound devotion off the field.

title: Joe Rogan slams UFC’s no-standup rule, cites Khabib as perfect dominance
content: Joe Rogan reignited debate by advocating for a "no standup" rule in MMA, asserting grapplers must earn their way up. He lauded Khabib Nurmagomedov as a rare fighter who made grappling exciting and effective, consistently finishing opponents. Rogan also proposed removing the cage, believing it aids strikers. These bold ideas continue to spark discussion.

title: Tom Aspinall’s father hints at hidden truth after UFC 321 eye poke drama
content: Tom Aspinall's heavyweight title defense against Ciryl Gane at UFC 321 ended prematurely due to an eye poke, resulting in a no-contest. Aspinall's father criticized the UFC's safety protocols, suggesting profit drives action. Despite the controversy, UFC President Dana White indicated a swift rematch is likely, citing fighter health and fan interest.

title: Lauren Kyle McDavid’s Influence on Edmonton’s Design and Lifestyle
content: While the Oilers faced a Stanley Cup Final loss, Lauren Kyle McDavid is forging her own path in Edmonton. Her innovative Trove Living concept, blending furniture, design, and a social hub, has become a vibrant downtown destination.  Her fashion brand and community involvement further solidify her commitment to the city, mirroring Connor's ambition.

title: Ronda Rousey and Travis Browne’s 2025 net worth: From UFC icons to Hollywood stars
content: Ronda Rousey and Travis Browne, once MMA stars, are now a power couple with a combined net worth of $15 million by 2025. Rousey's UFC and WWE success, plus acting, built her fortune. Browne also earned significantly from fighting. They have transitioned from combat sports to focus on family and business ventures.

title: IPL: 'Tell your husband to go easy on me' – Rahul’s complaint to cricketer’s wife
content: KL Rahul shared a humorous anecdote about his IPL 2025 camaraderie with Kevin Pietersen. Their constant banter, which extended to Rahul jokingly complaining to Pietersen's wife, became a highlight for Delhi Capitals fans.  Rahul revealed the on-field exchanges were just a fraction of their playful rivalry, showcasing a strong bond.

title: Sleeping in dark vs sleeping in light: Impact of sleep style on a person's life span
content: Sleeping in darkness is crucial for the body's repair and regulation, as light disrupts melatonin production and vital systems. Even moderate light exposure during sleep negatively impacts heart rate and insulin sensitivity, increasing long-term health risks. Prioritizing complete darkness promotes restorative sleep, enhancing mood, memory, and immune function for a healthier, longer life.

title: 500 Indians detained in Thailand: MEA to fly them home - why they fled Myanmar
content: The ministry of external affairs is working to repatriate nearly 500 Indians detained in Thailand after crossing from Myanmar. These individuals are believed to be victims or perpetrators of cyber scam hubs operating in Southeast Asia. India previously repatriated 549 nationals rescued from similar facilities.

title: Taylor Swift NFL exit: Fans debate if Charlie Kirk or a stalker is to blame
content: Taylor Swift has adopted a lower profile at NFL games this season due to heightened security concerns following online threats and a trespassing incident.  She's prioritizing privacy and safety, using discreet entrances and shielded viewing areas. This shift reflects a personal decision to step back from the intense spotlight, focusing on her relationship with Travis Kelce away from public scrutiny.

title: IND vs AUS: Gill and Abhishek’s fun moments steal the spotlight during rain delay - Watch
content: Despite a rain-marred start to the T20I series against Australia in Canberra, Indian fans found joy in the camaraderie of opening partners Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma. Gill showcased fluent form, while Suryakumar Yadav reached a significant milestone of 150 T20I sixes. The promising partnership and Yadav's return to form offered encouraging signs ahead of the next match.

title: Gabrielle Union recalls Hollywood discrimination in throwback interview
content: Gabrielle Union recently revealed her experiences with workplace discrimination in Hollywood, citing how her appearance was deemed acceptable but not to overshadow white leads. She often played the 'sassy friend' role in early 2000s films. Despite these challenges, Union has established herself as a credible actress and enjoys a comfortable life with husband Dwyane Wade.

title: PM Modi, Japan counterpart Takaichi exchange first call, discuss strategic ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Japan's new leader Sanae Takaichi held their first conversation, emphasizing the critical role of robust India-Japan ties for global peace and prosperity. They committed to deepening their special strategic partnership, focusing on economic security, defense, and collaboration in the Indo-Pacific, including through the Quad.

title: Heart health: Expert explains why plaques form in arteries and how to reverse the damage
content: Heart disease, a silent killer, stems from fatty plaque buildup in arteries. These plaques, composed of fats, cholesterol, calcium, and fibrin, narrow vessels, restricting blood flow and raising heart attack risks. Experts urge adopting a healthy diet, regular exercise, quitting smoking, and managing blood pressure and diabetes to prevent this dangerous buildup. Medical interventions may also be necessary.

title: Sugar, honey, or monk fruit: Which is healthier, according to a nutritionist
content: Sweeteners spark debate: nutritionist Suman Agarwal clarifies options beyond sugar. While jaggery and honey offer some benefits, they aren't calorie-free. Dates are a good choice in moderation. Zero-calorie stevia and monk fruit are safer alternatives to artificial sweeteners. Ultimately, limiting all added sugars, even healthier ones, is key for long-term health, according to WHO guidelines and studies.

title: Telangana: Mohammed Azharuddin set to join Revanth Reddy’s cabinet tomorrow
content: Mohammed Azharuddin is set to join the Telangana cabinet. This move by the Congress government aims to secure votes from the Muslim community in the upcoming Jubilee Hills by-election. Azharuddin will be the sole minister from the minority community. His appointment is a strategic decision to address voter concerns and strengthen the party's secular image.

title: Ayesha Curry says Stephen once dreamed of coaching high school basketball
content: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, revealed on a podcast she never anticipated their immense fame, expecting a quieter life focused on her own career. She also shared surprise at early pregnancies, which she felt derailed her personal ambitions. These candid remarks have led to public backlash, despite Stephen's silence.

title: Rajasthan: Lawyers vandalise event to inaugurate Ajmer court building
content: Lawyers in Ajmer protested the inauguration of a new court building by setting fire to decorations and blocking a major road. They expressed anger over the severe lack of chambers and parking facilities, with only 83 chambers available for over 2,000 lawyers. The protest occurred even as the acting Rajasthan High Court Chief Justice was present.

title: Fabulist Donald Trump indicates trade deal with India imminent
content: US President Donald Trump signaled an imminent trade deal with India, praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi and claiming he averted an India-Pakistan war with tariff threats. The provisional agreement reportedly lowers US tariffs on Indian exports and includes India increasing US energy imports and purchasing US corn and military hardware.

title: Paresh Rawal on The Taj Story controversy: 'Never intended to create Hindu-Muslim conflict'
content: Just days ahead of its nationwide release, Paresh Rawal’s film The Taj Story has landed in controversy after two Public Interest Litigations (PILs) were filed against it. Breaking his silence, the veteran actor has now responded to the allegations and clarified that the film does not promote any communal agenda.

title: Dove Cameron & Damiano David are engaged; actress spotted with engagement ring
content: Pop star Dove Cameron and Måneskin frontman Damiano David are reportedly engaged after two years of dating. Cameron was spotted sporting a large diamond ring during a stroll in Sydney, fueling fan speculation that David proposed on their recent second anniversary. The couple's social media posts hint at their deep affection for each other.

title: Tom Aspinall eye-poke row deepens as Aljamain Sterling doubles down on remarks
content: UFC 321 saw Tom Aspinall's title defense against Ciryl Gane end prematurely due to an accidental eye poke. Former champion Aljamain Sterling believes Aspinall's "I cannot see" statement pressured the referee, suggesting a different approach. Despite backlash, Sterling maintains his stance, sparking debate on Aspinall's reaction and the fight's outcome.

title: Airline unfairly charges premium, when free seats available - how passengers won case
content: A Navi Mumbai couple successfully sued an airline for charging ₹7,200 for adjacent seat reservations, a practice deemed an unfair trade practice. The Maharashtra State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission upheld a lower court's order, stating the airline used a 'dark pattern' by withholding information about available free seats, misleading passengers into paying extra.

title: Slap treason case in 'anthem' row, orders Assam CM Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has ordered treason charges against Congress members after a senior functionary sang Bangladesh's national anthem at a meeting. Sarma condemned the act as a "grave insult to national sentiments," linking it to a "Greater Bangladesh" narrative.

title: Russia ignores Trump: Kremlin tests another nuclear-powered weapon - what is Poseidon?
content: President Putin announced Russia's successful test of the nuclear-powered 'Poseidon' underwater drone, claiming it's uninterceptable and surpasses the 'Sarmat' missile. This follows a recent test of the 'Burevestnik' missile, occurring amidst Western pressure over Ukraine and Donald Trump's call for Russia to end the conflict.

title: 'PM, CM seats not vacant': Shah taunts Rahul, Tejashwi; attacks dynastic politics
content: Union home minister Amit Shah launched a strong attack on the INDIA bloc in Bihar, accusing Congress and RJD leaders of dynastic politics and corruption. He asserted that the ambitions of Sonia Gandhi and Lalu Prasad Yadav to see their sons in top posts would fail, as the Prime Minister and Chief Minister positions are not vacant.

title: 'Go straight to paradise': Crushed by Op Sindoor, JeM chief gets desperate
content: Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Masood Azhar has launched 'Jamaat-ul-Mominaat,' a new women's wing, detailing plans for recruitment, indoctrination, and deployment in a 21-minute audio message. Women will undergo training mirroring male programs, with the promise of paradise for joining the "global jihad" mission.

title: Not AI, but iPhone! How Apple hit $4 trillion mark — explained in charts
content: Apple has achieved a remarkable $4 trillion market capitalisation, driven by robust iPhone sales and renewed investor confidence. This milestone, despite lagging in the AI race, highlights the enduring strength of its ecosystem. Analysts see this as a watershed moment, with the latest iPhone models significantly boosting the company's value and signaling a strong upgrade cycle.

title: Joe Flacco injury: How Bengals QB status impacts Chase, Higgins in Week 9
content: Joe Flacco’s shoulder injury puts the Cincinnati Bengals' offense in a difficult position heading into Week 9 against the Chicago Bears. Flacco being sidelined would push Jake Browning back under center, reducing the scoring outlook for Ja’Marr Chase, Tee Higgins, and Chase Brown. Despite a favorable matchup, the Bengals’ passing game faces a clear downturn if Flacco cannot play.

title: Trade trouble? India-bound Russian oil tanker takes U-turn; here's why
content: A Russian crude oil tanker bound for India has altered its course and is now stationary in the Baltic Sea. This could indicate possible complications in crude oil trade between the two nations following stricter US sanctions against Russia.

title: Sources: Twins pick Shelton to be next manager
content: The Twins are turning to Derek Shelton to be their new manager, sources confirmed to ESPN on Wednesday.

title: La. Gov.: LSU AD won't select new football coach
content: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry told reporters Wednesday that LSU athletic director Scott Woodward won't be involved in selecting the Tigers' new football coach in the wake of Brian Kelly's firing.

title: Hawks star Young exits game with knee sprain
content: Trae Young was ruled out of the Hawks' game at Brooklyn with a right knee sprain after teammate Mouhamed Gueye fell into his leg late in the first quarter Wednesday.

title: Dodgers make changes; Ohtani offers bullpen help
content: The Dodgers moved catcher Will Smith into the No. 2 spot for Game 5 of the World Series and replaced struggling Andy Pages with Alex Call at the bottom of the lineup.

title: Marchand steps away to help friend after tragedy
content: Brad Marchand is stepping away from the Panthers to help coach a junior hockey team in place of friend JP MacCallum, whose daughter died last week of cancer.

title: Arch practices, still in protocol, iffy vs. Vanderbilt
content: Longhorns quarterback Arch Manning, who is recovering from a concussion, returned to practice Wednesday and is questionable for Saturday's game vs. Vanderbilt.

title: Lawrence blasts 'delusional' Giants legend Banks
content: Dexter Lawrence ripped Carl Banks over his recent comments, saying the Giants legend is "delusional."

title: Wentz defends Vikings: Nobody 'forcing me' to play
content: Carson Wentz on Wednesday sought to diffuse the controversy over his painful final appearance as the Vikings' QB, saying he bears no ill will toward the franchise and making clear he did not want coach Kevin O'Connell to remove him from Thursday's game.

title: What to expect at the NFL trade deadline for every team: Perfect fits, candidates to move and big needs
content: Let's outline deadline plans for all 32 franchises, including who could be moved or targeted before 4 p.m. ET on Nov. 4. Here's everything to know.

title: What we're hearing on the trade deadline and Week 9
content: The latest on Breece Hall, Trey Hendrickson, Jakobi Meyers and several under-the-radar trade targets.

title: Health, hot starts and early trends: Best and worst from the first week of NBA
content: Our insiders break down standout moments and answer the biggest questions from the first days of the NBA season.

title: Men's college basketball megapreview, predictions for this season
content: Can Florida repeat? Here's your guide to the new season, from Final Four picks to conference winner predictions.

title: Top 25 women's NCAA basketball players ranked going into 2025-26
content: A sophomore sits atop our preseason rankings, which include multiple players from UConn, UCLA and LSU.

title: 'Toughest player I've ever seen': The Legend of Haynes King
content: Stories about how the quarterback became one of the quirkiest, toughest and most insatiable players in college football.

title: What to know with 100 days until the Milan-Cortina Olympics
content: The 2026 Olympics will have more sports and more athletes than any Winter Games in history. We've got 100 things to know.

title: Slot machine: Carabao Cup gamble puts pressure on Liverpool's next match
content: Arne Slot's Liverpool continue their bad run of form following their elimination at the hands of Crystal Palace in the Carabao Cup, adding more pressure for the Dutchman.

title: Pochettino the player: How Mauricio Pochettino's playing days shaped the USMNT coach
content: Before he was a manager, there was Mauricio Pochettino the player, and his old teammates saw signs of the successful coaching career that was to come.

title: 'No, no, it was an optical illusion': How the NFL shut down a field goal controversy
content: Did Vikings' Will Reichard hit a camera wire on his FG attempt in London? He says yes -- the NFL says no.

title: Cam Skattebo's injury: What it means for the RB, the Giants and their future
content: Skattebo's injury is a massive loss for the Giants. It's equally demoralizing for the team and the fan base.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams land after one week of regular-season play
content: Hot starts or early burnouts? Where all 30 teams rank after one week of the 2025-26 NBA regular season.

title: Hoop Collective Q&A: What are the next steps in the NBA's gambling investigations?
content: ESPN spoke with former federal prosecutor Kate Reilly for an in-depth look at what comes next in the NBA gambling investigations.

title: Pushed to the periphery, Nwaneri seizes his chance to shine for Arsenal
content: Ethan Nwaneri has hardly gotten on the pitch after his breakout last season. On Wednesday, he reminded everyone how much talent he possesses.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo's race to 1,000 goals: When will he reach that remarkable number?
content: It seems like a matter of when, not if, Ronaldo scores his 1,000th goal, especially after reaching 950.

title: Why are USWNT players signing with clubs in Europe -- and can the NWSL stop it?
content: While NWSL execs worry about USWNT players choosing European clubs, the lure of UEFA Women's Champions League clubs isn't going away.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Rams, Chargers among top options in Week 9
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 9, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Why you may want to sit Bo Nix, start Travis Hunter and trade Christian McCaffrey
content: Liz has feelings about who you should start and sit this week and a fact to consider about Christian McCaffrey

title: NFL matchup rankings: Upgrade Daniel Jones, downgrade Travis Kelce
content: The most and least favorable matchups for Week 9 at quarterback, running back, wide receiver and tight end.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 9
content: Does Notre Dame need to run the table? We try to make sense of the constantly evolving playoff picture conference by conference.

title: What's left for the 2026 recruiting class: Coaching changes, flips to watch and more
content: We've updated our player rankings. There's a new top QB and new five-star, but classes could be in flux.

title: 'A moment of glory': How the daughter of two Ohio State 'i dotters' fulfilled her destiny
content: Sydney Reeves grew up with two Ohio State sousaphone players for parents. She always knew what she had to do.

title: 200 plays on a wristband?! Why some NFL QBs wear play sheets on their wrists and others don't
content: Some QBs like the way wristbands speed up the process, but others, such as Dak Prescott, don't want to lose eye contact.

title: Why the Saints are turning to QB Tyler Shough now
content: After benching Spencer Rattler during their Week 8 loss, the Saints will start their second-round pick Sunday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Haaland to replace Vinícius at Real Madrid?
content: Real Madrid could look to Man City striker Erling Haaland to replace forward Vinícius Júnior. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Urdu is the most beautiful language, says Kiren Rijiju
content: The Minority Affairs Minister said Hindu-Muslim harmony is vital for India’s growth, in his address at the 105th foundation day of the Jamia Milia Islamia University

title: Treason case to be filed against Congress leaders for singing Bangladesh national anthem: Assam CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma alleged that singing the anthem was the Opposition party’s  endorsement of the claim by a section of leaders in Bangladesh that the entire northeast region is part of the neighbouring nation

title: Row intensifies over death of person over NRC fears in WB, Trinamool announces protest
content: Trinamool Congress general secretary Abhishek Banerjee told the people that if they see BJP leaders they should,  “tie them up and tell them they will be let go once they produce their father’s and grandfather’s certificates”.

title: 2-day online camp offers positivity skill training for teens
content: MiTran Global’s Imparting Positivity Camp offers a two-day online programme for teens aged 11–17, blending academic skills with emotional resilience; register now at https://hub.mitranglobal.com/services/ipc

title: Japan PM Takaichi calls PM Modi, hopes for ‘golden chapter’ in ties with India
content: The conversation focused on the Quad, economic and defence cooperation; no clarity on summit dates yet

title: Campaigning heats up for Nuapada bypoll in Odisha as BJP, Cong., BJD vie for victory
content: As the constituency has a heterogeneous population, political parties cannot afford a one-size-fits-all strategy to win the trust of voters

title: Cyber thieves outpace banks’ response time in cybercrime cases
content: While some bank officials, fully aware of the Reserve Bank of India’s guidelines on customer liability, attempt to shift responsibility, others end up misleading victims, at times even advising them to change their registered mobile numbers, instead of taking immediate remedial action.

title: M.B. Patil blames Centre’s incentives to Andhra Pradesh for Google setting up AI data centre in Visakhapatnam
content: Minister for Large and Medium Industries M.B. Patil has blamed the Centre’s incentives to Andhra Pradesh behind Google’s choice for setting up its AI Data Centre in Visakhapatnam

title: Indian IT industry big contributor to business-driven air travel and carbon footprint: Report
content: Enforcing sustainable travel policies such as flying economy, choosing non-stop flights, trains or buses, and capping frequent flyer trips are among the recommendations made to IT companies in a report on the ‘Urgency and Potential of Aviation Impact Mitigation In India’

title: Karnataka govt. mulls law to implement internal reservation
content: The Karnataka Scheduled Castes (Sub-classification) Bill, 2025, which is ready, will be piloted in the winter session of the legislature

title: LDF, UDF lock horns over audit reports at Kochi Corporation Council meeting
content: While the LDF, led by Mayor M. Anilkumar, contended that the audit reports revealed corruption and profligacy during the previous UDF administration, the Opposition argued that the reports were tabled in the council in violation of the Kerala Municipality Act

title: Cyclone Montha: DISCOMs incur loss of ₹17.84 crore on account of damages to infra
content: Over 11,000 employees from various cadres were deployed in the affected areas to prevent interruptions to electricity supply, says Chief Secretary

title: Bengaluru start-ups captured a whopping $38 bn from VCs during 2020-24: Priyank Kharge
content: Despite a global meltdown, Karnataka-based start-ups have raised $1.7 billion of funds in the first half of 2025, the highest by any State

title: Netizens hail MLA’s proud post on wife’s achievement
content: A postgraduate in mathematics, Thiruvambady MLA Linto Joseph’s wife K. Anusha is now part of the Kerala Armed Police Women’s battalion

title: District-level panel to examine complaints on waste treatment factory
content: Latest field-level study reports by PCB and Suchitwa Mission to be discussed before giving nod to reopen the waste treatment plant

title: EPFO to simplify claim processes, conduct awareness campaign
content: Karnataka has 60,000 business establishments registered with EPFO, of which 38,000 are in Bengaluru alone, cumulatively covering some 72 to 78 lakh of subscribers

title: Eco Sense scholarships for students launched
content: Rolled out by Local Self-Governments department and General Education department, it aims at nurturing ecologically sensible citizens

title: Cyclone Montha leaves 2 dead, flattens crops in A.P.
content: Agricultural crops across 87,000 hectares inundated; the severe cyclonic storm also damaged roads and bridges, and uprooted trees, officials said; CM takes stock of damage, says loss of life and property minimised due to measures taken by the State government

title: Sizeable number of militants neutralised during Operation Sindoor: Rajnath
content: Defence Minister praises Prime Minister Narendra Modi for restoring India’s pride and stature on the global stage. He says the Opposition’s election promise of providing a government job to every household is unrealistic and misleading.

title: Mayawati seeks Muslim support, targets rival parties for neglecting minorities
content: The former chief minister accused both the SP and Congress of historically engaging in politics that was “anti-Dalit, anti-backward, and anti-Muslim”

title: Political parties reiterate their opinion on SIR at meeting chaired by CEO
content: While the ruling DMK questioned the timing of the exercise, the principal Opposition party, the AIADMK, welcomed it.

title: Supreme Court decides to examine reasons behind chronic delay in trial courts to frame charges, links it to pendency
content: Section 251 (1) (b) of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (BNSS) mandates that charges must be framed within 60 days in cases triable by a Court of Session

title: US Ends Automatic Renewal Of Work Permits, Indian Workforce To Be Impacted
content: In a statement on Wednesday, the US Department of Homeland Security said "Aliens who file to renew their EAD on or after Oct. 30, 2025 (Thursday), will no longer receive an automatic extension of their EAD."

title: Florida Universities Ban H-1B Visa Hiring To Prioritise American Graduates
content: In a move aimed at cracking down on H-1B visa abuse in higher education, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has ordered institutions in the state to hire Americans to fill university jobs and end the practice of importing foreign workers on work visas.

title: "Many Forces Will Attempt To Thwart" Bangladesh Polls: Muhammad Yunus
content: Bangladesh's interim government chief Muhammad Yunus on Wednesday said he feared forces "from home and abroad" to thwart planned general elections over debarring deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina's Awami League from contesting.

title: Video: 4 Killed In Latest US Strike On Alleged Pacific Drug Boat
content: The US military on Wednesday struck another boat in the Pacific it claimed was trafficking drugs, killing four people, Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth said.

title: Every Moment Of Space Journey "Unforgettable", Says Shubhanshu Shukla
content: Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, the first Indian to step aboard the International Space Station (ISS) as part of the Axiom Mission-4 earlier this year, described his space journey on Wednesday as "unforgettable".

title: Radio Free Asia Suspends Operations After Trump Cuts Funding, Shutdown
content: Radio Free Asia, founded nearly three decades ago to report on China and other Asian countries without independent media, said Wednesday it will halt production after the US government ceased funding.

title: 6 Soldiers Killed In Blast In Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
content: At least six soldiers, including a Captain, were killed in an IED blast targeting a convoy of the security forces in Pakistan's northwestern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province on Wednesday, the Inter Services Public Relations (ISPR), the military's media wi

title: Trump Says South Korea Has Approval To Build Nuclear-Powered Submarine
content: US President Donald Trump said Thursday he has given approval for ally South Korea to build a nuclear powered submarine, a day after the two countries said they have reached a broad trade deal.

title: Ex-US Police Officer Found Guilty Of Murder In Shooting Of Black Woman
content: A former Illinois sheriff's deputy was convicted of murder on Wednesday for the shooting of a Black woman inside her home, in a case that drew national attention and calls for police reform.

title: King Charles, Queen Camilla Visit London's Iconic Neasden Temple
content: Britain's King Charles III and Queen Camilla on Wednesday observed prayers and spiritual offerings during a visit to mark the 30th anniversary celebrations of BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir, popularly known as Neasden Temple, in London.

title: "I Was In Guilt": Actor Vijay Breaks Down As He Meets Stampede Victims' Families
content: Actor and Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) Chief Vijay broke down on Monday as he met families of victims of the stampede that killed 41 people at his rally in Karur last month.

title: More Than 100 Killed In War-Like Rio Raids On Powerful Narco Gang
content: Residents of a Rio de Janeiro community lined up their dead in the street Wednesday after Brazil's bloodiest police raid killed at least 119 people, spotlighting the city's controversial war against drug gangs entrenched in poor neighborhoods.

title: Trump, Xi To Meet After 6 Years Today, Tariffs And Tensions High On Agenda
content: After a six-year gap, US President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping are set to meet on Thursday in Busan on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit.

title: Maharashtra Leader Agrees To Shift Farmers' Protest From Nagpur Highway
content: Former MLA Bachchu Kadu, who is leading a massive protest for farm loan waiver, on Wednesday evening said they will vacate the national highway.

title: Pune-based Gangster Nilesh Ghaywal Is In London: UK High Commission
content: The UK High Commission in India has confirmed that fugitive gangster Nilesh Ghaywal is in London on 'visitor' visa.

title: Nepal Rescues Over 1,500 Tourists From Himalayas Post Heavy Snowfall
content: Nepali security forces have rescued over 1,500 stranded tourists from the high-altitude areas of Manang following heavy snowfall and adverse weather.

title: NDTV Reports 14% Revenue Growth In Q2 Over Q1, Strengthens Content Line-Up
content: NDTV reported a 14 per cent growth in revenue in the second quarter of FY26 over Q1 FY26, and a 10 per cent increase compared to Q2 FY25, the company said in an exchange filing on Wednesday.

title: India, China Agree To Maintain Peace, Stability Along LAC In Eastern Ladakh
content: India and China held a fresh round of high-level military talks focusing on maintaining peace and security along the Line of Actual Control in eastern Ladakh using existing mechanisms.

title: Chargesheet Filed In Dalit Techie Dishonour Killing, Accused Cop Denied Bail
content: Filing a detailed chargesheet in the dishonour killing of Dalit techie Kavin in Tamil Nadu's Tirunelveli, the Crime Branch-CID (CBCID) has reiterated that the 23-year-old software engineer was hacked to death by his girlfriend's brother.

title: US Lifts Sanctions On Bosnian Serb Leader Dodik, Citing 'Defused Crisis'
content: The US Treasury Department on Wednesday lifted sanctions on Bosnian Serb nationalist leader Milorad Dodik, his allies, and family members and companies related to them, the Office of Foreign Assets Control announced.

title: Congress accuses Modi government of reviving Manusmriti principles in labour policy
content: Congress general secretary (communications) Jairam Ramesh claimed that the RSS had opposed the Constitution soon after its adoption for not being based on the Manusmriti

title: 1.3 million vehicles hit Hyderabad IT corridor despite continuous rain; staggered work hours help avert gridlock
content: Officials reported a 30% increase in cars and 8% rise in auto-rickshaws compared to normal days as continuous rains drove more commuters to use personal and covered transport

title: Central Pay Commission’s terms of reference rigid: AITUC general secretary
content: All India Trade Union Congress (AITUC) leader Amarjeet Kaur says decision to form CPC was announced before Delhi Assembly polls in Delhi but went to the cold storage till the Bihar election; she says it is an injustice on the government staff to wait for nearly two years for its implementation

title: India focused on technology driven transformation of justice system: Law Minister
content: The Minister said the justice system will also be made business friendly to promote India as an investment destination

title: YSRCP steps up ‘one-crore signature movement’ against govt.’s PPP model for medical colleges
content: Party terms move to privatise government medical colleges ‘anti-poor’, says it will deny affordable healthcare and education to lakhs of families

title: Montha spares Narsapuram coast, Uppada coast bears the brunt
content: No lives lost, 268 trees fallen or uprooted, 61 houses damaged along the Kakinada coast; fisherman missing near deepsea port, NDRF intensifies search operations

title: Developing countries need 12 times more funds than currently available to tackle climate crisis
content: UN analysis says developing countries will need at least $310 billion annually for adaptation by 2035; they only got $26 billion in 2023; warns that a rising proportion of climate funds comes as expensive debt

title: GCCs in city shape global markets, experiences
content: Transformed Hyderabad into a global command centre, connecting Chicago to Charminar, Boston to Banjara Hills and London to Lingampally: Telangana Deputy CM

title: CPI(M) backs demand for new tribal district in Andhra Pradesh
content: Party opposes move to merge Chinturu, Rampachodavaram with East Godavari; urges government to hold public consultations before finalising boundaries

title: Liposuction gone wrong: State apex medical body rules out medical negligence
content: Post-surgical complications led to the amputation of fingers of a 31-year-old woman who had undergone liposuction surgery in a private cosmetic clinic in the city

title: PM SHRI rollout put on hold, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan constitutes Cabinet subcommittee to examine CPI’s concerns
content: General Education Minister V. Sivankutty will chair the committee.  The other members are Revenue Minister K. Rajan (CPI), Agriculture Minister P. Prasad (CPI),  Law Minister P.Rajeeve (CPI-M), Electricity Minister K. Krishnankutty (Janata Dal-Secular), Water Resources Minister Roshy Augustine (Kerala Congress-M) and Forest Minister A.K. Saseendran (Nationalist Congress Party)

title: Energy Minister reviews power restoration in cyclone-hit areas
content: Ravi Kumar directs officials to complete restoration in safe zones swiftly; additional SPDCL manpower deployed to speed up field operations

title: Kerala ASHAs grudgingly welcome honorarium hike of ₹1,000; to continue with strike
content: A paltry hike of ₹33 per day as opposed to the demanded minimum daily wage for govt. employees, which is ₹700, is too inadequate: KAHWA

title: Opposition objecting to SIR to protect ‘vote bank’: BJP
content: BJP alleges that Congress, Trinamool Congress and other parties were engaging in hypocrisy and appeasement politics

title: Andhra Pradesh reservoirs brim as heavy rains swell inflows
content: State’s major reservoirs hold 94.77% capacity; Srisailam and Nagarjuna Sagar near full with minimal flood cushion remaining

title: Priyanka seeks ST status for Kalanadi community
content: The MP raises the demand citing the Kalanadi community’s social, economic, and geographical backwardness, along with their declining population of just 328 members

title: Paddy farmers worried as cyclone devastates crops in Krishna
content: According to preliminary crop damage report, standing paddy crops on 45,040 hectares, blackgram on 985 hectares, groundnut on 288.2 hectares and cotton on all 43 hectares have been damaged

title: Public policies should help improve HDI, ensure sustainable environment development, says expert
content: Seminar on ‘Public Planning and Recent Trends’ organised jointly by the IIPA and the Department of Economics, Karnatak University, in Dharwad

title: India-EU FTA: 10 out of 20 chapters concluded, 4-5 more ‘broadly decided’, says Piyush Goyal
content: On whether FTA negotiations would be completed by the end of the year - a target set by PM Modi and EU Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen in February - Minister says the priority is a ‘good deal’ rather than meeting deadlines

title: Survey identifies 128 level crossings to be removed within 100 km of Bengaluru
content: This follows a directive issued in July by Union Minister of State for Railways V. Somanna, who instructed officials to eliminate all level crossings within this zone to enhance both rail and road safety

title: Welfare measures: Kerala govt. to incur additional burden of ₹10,000 cr.
content: Wednesday’s announcements by Chief Minister  include a hike of the social security/welfare fund board pensions to a monthly ₹2,000 and a new monthly ‘Sthree Suraksha’ pension of ₹1,000

title: DGCA to relax pilot duty time rules from November 1
content:
NEW DELHI: India will by Saturday implement relaxed flight duty time rules for pilots to ensure the cockpit crew operating flights are not fatigued. DGCA on Wednesday said the seven remaining clauses of revised flight duty time limitations (FDTL) would be implemented from Nov 1. Fifteen clauses of the relaxed rules were implemented on July 1, 2025. Pilots of big Indian carriers have long complained about punishing rosters and warned having fatigued pilots adversely impacts safety. "The implementation of (relaxed FDTL rules) has been undertaken in a structured and pha-sed manner, taking into consideration flight safety, operational feasibility, and overall dynamics of civil aviation operations," DGCA said.

End of Article

title: Stay off district judiciary, it's our domain: Allahabad HC to Supreme Court
content: 'Let HCs Frame Service Rules For Judicial Officers' brimmed over two-decade-long discontent over apex court framing service rules for state judicial officers . the high court told the supreme court to adopt a "hands-off approach" over the issue .

title: Edgecombe overtakes Flagg as ROY favorite; what it means for betting, fantasy
content: VJ Edgecombe ( +110 ) has officially surpassed Cooper Flagg ( +115 ) as the favorite to win the NBA's Rookie of the Year, according to ESPN BET . he is off to an amazing start, averaging 22.3 PPG, 5.8 RPG, 5.5 APG, 3.0 3PG and 1.5 SPG through his first four games while helping the Philadelphia 76ers to a surprising 4-0 start .

title: NBA gambling scandal follows familiar Mafia playbook
content: the alleged connection between the mafia and two former NBA players began through a little-known intermediary . prosecutors allege the intermediary was Robert L. Stroud, 67, a 67-year-old Louisville man with a criminal history . in 1994, he killed a man during an evening playing cards and gambling at a home .

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: A new UFC champion and an ex-champ enter women's top 10

title: Follow live: Blue Jays tally another run behind Clement's sac fly
content: All the  Toronto Blue Jays  had to do after losing  an 18-inning epic  in Game 3 of the  2025 World Series  was bounce back quickly -- and beat starting pitcher/DH  Shohei Ohtani  and the  Los Angeles Dodgers  in Game 4. Well, they did just that -- and the Fall Classic is tied at 2-2. With the series sure to head back to Toronto, what will happen in the final game in L.A.? Game 5's winner will be one victory from a ring; the loser will be one loss from heartbreak. Follow all the action -- from live analysis during the game to our postgame takeaways -- right here. Key links:  World Series schedule, results Gamecast:   Follow the action pitch-by-pitch here

title: ⬇ CFB Bottom 10: Hot seats get hotter
content: "Take this job and shove it I ain't working here no more My woman done left And took all the reasons I was working for You better not try to stand in my way" a-walking out the door "Take This Job and Shove It," Johnny Paycheck Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters, located behind the wall of industrial-sized cooling fans used to keep Pete Thamel's phone and laptop from overheating .

title: What Aidan Hutchinson's extension means, and which pass rushers are getting paid next
content: aidan Hutchinson has been a star for the team from day one . he finished second in the 2022 draft with a team-leading 9.5 sacks and a pro Bowl nod . the move means the franchise will have its best pass rusher for years to come .
